content.raw:
just as an experiment, i started up atlas (using gazebo 4 and our own ros plugins, not the libgazebo_ros_api.so, and without drcsim on my system), and then ran the r2 sim, and it works (i.e., i have both robots running in gazebo, and dont get the boost error).

I do get a new error, but i think this is just related to me blindly trying to start two gzservers at the same time:

```
[gazebo-1] process has died [pid 17607, exit code 255, cmd /opt/ros/indigo/lib/gazebo_ros/gzserver /home/swhart/ros/catkin_workspace/src/nasa_r2_simulator/r2_gazebo/gazebo/r2_empty.world __name:=gazebo __log:=/home/swhart/.ros/log/0533a6f0-b175-11e4-b6fe-f0761c1354e1/gazebo-1.log].
log file: /home/swhart/.ros/log/0533a6f0-b175-11e4-b6fe-f0761c1354e1/gazebo-1*.log

```
content.html:
just as an experiment, i started up atlas (using gazebo 4 and our own ros plugins, not the libgazebo_ros_api.so, and without drcsim on my system), and then ran the r2 sim, and it works (i.e., i have both robots running in gazebo, and dont get the boost error).

I do get a new error, but i think this is just related to me blindly trying to start two gzservers at the same time:

[gazebo-1] process has died [pid 17607, exit code 255, cmd /opt/ros/indigo/lib/gazebo_ros/gzserver /home/swhart/ros/catkin_workspace/src/nasa_r2_simulator/r2_gazebo/gazebo/r2_empty.world __name:=gazebo __log:=/home/swhart/.ros/log/0533a6f0-b175-11e4-b6fe-f0761c1354e1/gazebo-1.log].
log file: /home/swhart/.ros/log/0533a6f0-b175-11e4-b6fe-f0761c1354e1/gazebo-1*.log
